alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 8:07PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...ANOTHER BAND OF SNOW SPREADING ACROSS THE LOWER SNAKE RIVER PLAIN THROUGH 930 PM MDT... At 800 PM MST, a band of light to moderate snow was located along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Atomic City to 6 miles northeast of Cold Water Rest Area, moving east at 35 mph. In addition, numerous snow showers continued across the southern mountains. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are possible with this band as it spreads across the region through 930 PM MDT Locations impacted include... Pocatello, Blackfoot, Burley, Rupert, Preston, American Falls, Heyburn, Soda Springs, Montpelier, Malad, McCammon, Lava Hot Springs, Malta, Swanlake, Lake Walcott, Neeley, Blackfoot Reservoir, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Oakley Reservoir and Chesterfield Reservoir. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions as conditions can deteriorate rapidly. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads and poor visibility. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling or consider delaying or adjusting your travel.
